sgraph

Class LeafNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • sgraph.AbstractNode
      • sgraph.LeafNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INode

    public class LeafNode
extends AbstractNode
    This node represents the leaf of a scene graph. It is the only type of node that has actual geometry to render.
    Author:
    Amit Shesh

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Material material
      The material associated with the object instance at this leaf
      protected java.lang.String objInstanceName
      The name of the object instance that this leaf contains.

    • Field Detail

      • objInstanceName

        protected java.lang.String objInstanceName
        The name of the object instance that this leaf contains. All object instances are stored in the scene graph itself, so that an instance can be reused in several leaves

      • material

        protected Material material
        The material associated with the object instance at this leaf

    • Method Detail

      • setMaterial

        public void setMaterial(Material mat)
        Description copied from class: AbstractNode
        By default, throws an exception. Any nodes that are capable of storing material should override this method
        Specified by:
        setMaterial in interface INode
        Overrides:
        setMaterial in class AbstractNode
        Parameters:
        mat - the material object to be associated with this node

      • getMaterial

        public Material getMaterial()

      • clone

        public INode clone()
        Description copied from interface: INode
        Return a deep copy of the scene graph subtree rooted at this node
        Specified by:
        clone in interface INode
        Specified by:
        clone in class AbstractNode
        Returns:

      • draw

        public void draw(IScenegraphRenderer context,
        java.util.Stack<org.joml.Matrix4f> modelView)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Delegates to the scene graph for rendering. This has two advantages:
        • It keeps the leaf light.
        • It abstracts the actual drawing to the specific implementation of the scene graph renderer
        Parameters:
        context - the generic renderer context IScenegraphRenderer
        modelView - the stack of modelview matrices
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
